com.seagate.csp.gui.util

Class LocationConfig

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.seagate.csp.gui.util.LocationConfig

  • public class LocationConfig
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper methods to parse location specific config file parameters Config file example: LocationConfig.0.location = LCO LocationConfig.0.XmlTestOptionManager.url = http://a LocationConfig.0.A.url = http://a LocationConfig.0.B.url = http://b LocationConfig.0.C.url = http://c LocationConfig.1.location = SZ LocationConfig.1.XmlTestOptionManager.url = http://a11 LocationConfig.1.A.url = http://a1 LocationConfig.1.B.url = http://b1 LocationConfig.1.C.url = http://c1 LocationConfig.5.location = default LocationConfig.5.XmlTestOptionManager.url = http://a22 LocationConfig.5.A.url = http://a2 LocationConfig.5.B.url = http://b2 LocationConfig.5.C.url = http://c2 Note the "default" location, it is used if the specified location does not exist. The resulting map of properties for the config above: { "LCO" => {"location" => "LCO", "XmlTestOptionManager.url" => "http://a", "A.url" => "http://a", "B.url" => "http://b", "C.url" => "http://c"}, "SZ" => {...}, "default" => {...} }
